alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford; Dubois; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Orange; Perry; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 3:57AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A MIX OF RAIN AND FREEZING RAIN POSSIBLE TONIGHT ACROSS SOUTHERN INDIANA AND PARTS OF NORTHERN KENTUCKY... After a brief break in the precipitation across the region today, the next wave of precipitation is forecast to move into the region this evening and into the overnight hours. As this precipitation moves into the region, surface temperatures will drop to near freezing across southern Indiana and over portions of far northern Kentucky. The rain may mix with or change over to a period of freezing rain tonight. Some light icing accumulations will be possible, mainly north of the Ohio River in southern Indiana. At this time there is considerable uncertainty in whether icing will occur in areas south of the Ohio River. Forecasters at the National Weather Service will continue to look over data later this morning and this afternoon. It is possible that a Winter Weather Advisory may be issued later today for portions of southern Indiana and northern Kentucky if later data suggests a higher threat of icing. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest updates.
